link.synopsis: In an effort to prevent family history from repeating itself, meddlesome mom Daphne Wilder (Diane Keaton) attempts to set up her youngest daughter, Milly (Mandy Moore), with Mr. Right. Meanwhile, her other daughters (Lauren Graham and Piper Perabo) try to keep their mom's good intentions under control. Tom Everett Scott, Colin Ferguson and Gabriel Macht also star in director Michael Lehmann's multigenerational mother-daughter comedy.
link.title: synopsis
I Could Never Be Your Woman
The Boys and Girl from County Clare

link.synopsis: In this Sundance Audience Award-winning comedy from director Nigel Cole, newly widowed Grace (Brenda Blethyn) finds herself in financial ruin when she discovers that her dearly departed husband has left her deep in debt. With the help of her gardener, Matt (Craig Ferguson), Grace applies her green thumb to ganja plants -- and soon, everyone in her small English town is getting high on more than life.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: Craig Ferguson: A Wee Bit o' Revolution
The Englishman Who Went Up a Hill but Came Down a Mountain
Doc Martin and the Legend of the Cloutie

link.synopsis: It's five galloping (and utterly adorable) golden retriever pups to the rescue when Mom and Dad get dognapped in this Disney family comedy featuring the voices of Don Knotts and Michael Clarke Duncan. The pups' ability to talk makes the mission easier, but danger and high jinks still abound as the dogs work to save their parents. Bonus material includes a "Train Your Dog to Be a Star" video and behind-the-scenes interviews with the pups.
link.title: synopsis
Lady and the Tramp II: Scamp's Adventure
Dr. Seuss' The Cat in the Hat
Cats & Dogs: The Revenge of Kitty Galore

link.synopsis: Set in a remote Norwegian town, this black comedy centers on cheerful housewife Kaja (Agnes Kittlesen), who is contentedly wedded to her loveless high school sweetheart but lands in hot water when a risqu encounter with her urbane new neighbor, Sigve (Henrik Rafaelsen), goes too far. With a full-blown affair on her hands and Christmas just around the corner, Kaja falls back on blinding optimism to get her through the snowballing scandal.
link.title: synopsis
The Other Side of the Bed
The Girl Who Played with Fire

link.synopsis: When the dysfunctional Cleveland clan, led by eccentric soda tycoon Eugene (Harry Dean Stanton), is forced to wait out a twister on dad's estate in rural Kansas, the family mansion may be too small for this group of colorful oddballs. Crispin Glover, Suzy Amis and Dylan McDermott star in this comedy based on Mary Robison's novel &NFi;Oh!&NFi_; and co-starring Charlayne Woodard, Lois Chiles and Jenny Wright. Tim Robbins and William S. Burroughs also appear.
link.title: synopsis
Daddy's Dyin' ... Who's Got the Will?

link.synopsis: Sandra Bullock, Ashley Judd, Ellen Burstyn, James Garner and Maggie Smith star in this Southern-fried comedy, based on Rebecca Wells's best-selling novels, which follows a group of lifelong friends over decades of ups and downs. Forced to resort to intervention to help their friend's daughter, Siddalee (Bullock), cope and forgive her eccentric mother (Burstyn) for inflicting years of pain and embarrassment, the Ya-Yas don't hold anything back.
link.title: synopsis
How to Make an American Quilt
The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants
The Five People You Meet in Heaven
Oprah Winfrey Presents: Mitch Albom's For One More Day
The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants 2

title.regular: Divine Secrets of the Ya-Ya Sisterhood
title.short: Divine Secrets of the Ya-Ya Sisterhood

link.synopsis: College-educated Annie Braddock (Scarlett Johansson) gets a crash course in child care when she plays nanny to the 4-year-old son of grossly dysfunctional parents (Laura Linney and Paul Giamatti) in this all-star comedy from director Shari Springer Berman (American Splendor). The film was adapted from the best-selling novel by Emma McLaughlin and Nicola Kraus, who based their book on their experiences working for Manhattan's wealthiest families.
link.title: synopsis
I Could Never Be Your Woman
The Night of the White Pants

link.synopsis: Unable to live up to the reputation of his heroic cop father, police officer Dinkar Waghmare quits. But five days before he's due to leave the force, Dinkar loses his gun -- which sets off a series of events that unexpectedly turns him into a hero. As he tries to find the lost weapon, Dinkar encounters underworld characters and unwittingly solves crimes. Shreyas Talpade, Kay Kay Menon and Shiv Pandit star in this Hindi comedy.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: When a traveling carnival comes to a small town, the proprietor, Mr. Dark (Jonathan Pryce), promises to make residents' dreams come true. But the price turns out to be steep, as those dreams slowly spiral into a nightmare. Now, two boys (Vidal Peterson and Shawn Carson) must try to fight the sinister force infesting the town. Based on a Ray Bradbury novel, this surreal psychological thriller co-stars Jason Robards, Diane Ladd and Pam Grier.
link.title: synopsis
The Little Girl Who Lives Down the Lane
Star Trek III: The Search for Spock
Star Trek IV: The Voyage Home
Star Trek VI: The Undiscovered Country
Journey to the Center of the Earth

link.synopsis: In this all-star sequel to the hit comedy Meet the Parents, hard-to-crack ex-CIA man Jack Byrnes and his wife, Dina, head for the warmer climes of Florida to meet son-in-law-to-be Greg Focker's freewheeling and affectionate mom and dad.
link.title: synopsis
Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me
Revenge of the Nerds IV: Nerds in Love
Austin Powers: International Man of Mystery

link.synopsis: When his brother is accused of murdering a high school teacher, undercover cop Nick Dunbar (Arliss Howard) tries to clear his sibling's name by posing as a student to investigate the killing, but he finds himself sucked into a vortex of teen angst. Dunbar is sidetracked by bullies, love triangles and a power-mad principal (Robert Stack) as he tries to hone in on the true culprit in this quirky comedy from director Martha Coolidge.
link.title: synopsis
Take This Job and Shove It

link.synopsis: Knowledge is good, but swilling kegs of beer is more fun! Just ask the guys at the Delta House fraternity. Often imitated, but seldom equaled, Animal House spawned a generation of gonzo comedies and launched John Belushi's film career. Dean Wormer (John Vernon) puts the titular frat on double-secret probation, and it's up to Bluto, Flounder, Pinto and the rest of the brothers to get even. This edition includes retrospective featurettes and more.
link.title: synopsis
Van Wilder 2: The Rise of Taj
Revenge of the Nerds 2: Nerds in Paradise
National Lampoon's Ratko: The Dictator's Son

link.synopsis: In this slapstick comedy, a governor's secret orders send two small-town deputies, Dewey (Tim Conway) and Wallace (Chuck McCann), undercover as criminals in a maximum security prison to find out where a gang of crooks has stashed its loot. But the governor suddenly dies, and with no one to vouch for them, Dewey and Wallace must convince the disbelieving warden of their true identities or face years of hard time.
link.title: synopsis
The Zany Adventures of Robin Hood
Don't Worry, We'll Think of a Title
The Last Time I Saw Archie
The Return of the Pink Panther

link.synopsis: Eddie Murphy established himself as a comedy superstar playing streetwise hustler Billy Ray Valentine, who trades places with wealthy investment executive Louis Winthorpe III (Dan Aykroyd) to see whether circumstances truly do make the man. It's all part of a bet cooked up by the rich, greedy Duke brothers (Don Ameche and Ralph Bellamy). But when Valentine and Winthorpe find out about the wager, the payback begins. Jamie Lee Curtis co-stars.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: W.C. Fields Comedy Collection: The Bank Dick

link.synopsis: Director John Landis rolls out his first feature film in more than a decade with this black comedy based on the true exploits of two 19th-century body snatchers, played by Simon Pegg and Andy Serkis. When Burke and Hare's successful business -- selling corpses to the Edinburgh Medical College for dissection -- is hampered by a supply shortage, the men are forced to take drastic measures. Isla Fisher and Tim Curry also star.
link.title: synopsis
Don't Be Afraid of the Dark
Detective Dee and the Mystery of the Phantom Flame
How to Lose Friends & Alienate People

link.synopsis: This comedy follows the dilemmas of two families living in the same apartment complex in Vancouver. After same-sex marriage is sanctioned, lesbian couple Cara (Shirley Ng) and Janet (Natalie Sky) consider tying the knot, which won't sit well with Cara's parents. Meanwhile, downstairs neighbor Jesse (Trenton Millar), a homosexual teen, is elated when his long-absent gay father returns ... but Jesse's stepdad isn't.
link.title: synopsis
The Ultimate Lesbian Short Film Festival
Edie & Thea: A Very Long Engagement

link.synopsis: This rib-tickling episode of Joel Hodgson's cult comedy series has a guy and his robot pals sitting through the cheesy vintage drama The Rebel Set -- and, as usual, keeping a running commentary rife with witty, sarcastic remarks. The movie stars Edward Platt as coffee shop owner Mr. Tucker, who convinces three unemployed customers to help him rob an armored car. A short film, "Johnny at the Fair," is also included.
link.title: synopsis
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Manhunt in Space
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Corpse Vanishes
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Girl in Gold Boots
Mystery Science Theater 3000: I Accuse My Parents
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Monster a Go-Go
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Crawling Eye
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Red Zone Cuba
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Giant Gila Monster
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Warrior of the Lost World
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Beginning of the End
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Blood Waters of Dr. Z
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Secret Agent, Super Dragon
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Night of the Blood Beast
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Incredibly Strange Creatures Who Stopped Living and Became Mixed-Up Zombies
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Gamera vs. Guiron
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Atomic Brain
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Gamera vs. Zigra
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Touch of Satan
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Final Sacrifice
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Gamera vs. Gaos
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Gamera vs. Barugon

title.regular: Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Rebel Set

link.synopsis: Prison workers Bud (Charlie Sheen) and Larry (Thomas Haden Church) set their sights on a scam that could set them free from the jobs that keep them on their father-in-law's (Marlon Brando) radar. But robbring a train stocked with cash sets of a string of events they didn't see coming. Donald Sutherland, Mira Sorvino, Martin Sheen and David Arquette co-star in this quirky comedy. Yves Simoneau directs.
link.title: synopsis
How to Beat the High Cost of Living

link.synopsis: While on a family vacation at the French seaside, brooding 18-year-old Mathieu (Jeremie Elkaim) meets Cédric (Stephane Rideau), an attractive carefree boy his own age, and is swept away by the first stirrings of homosexual passion. Within a narrative that shifts between past and present, we witness their awkward, halting admissions of attraction and eventual submission to desire. All the while, Mathieu copes with his mother's crushing depression.
link.title: synopsis
From the Edge of the City
The Incredibly True Adventure of 2 Girls in Love

link.synopsis: In a plot that takes its cue from the 1976 comedy classic Bad News Bears, a reluctant coach (Richard Lincoln) signs up to lead a team of Little League misfits -- among them, a nose picker (Michael Pastore), an infielder with chronic flatulence (Sean P. Griffin) and a black-belted karate kid (Ted Oyama). Can this obvious bunch of losers turn it around to win their first championship, or will they let a rival team take them down?
link.title: synopsis
The Red Hand Gang: The Complete Series
The Life and Times of Hank Greenberg
Tall Tales & Legends: Casey at the Bat
Lucy Must Be Traded, Charlie Brown
Superman II: The Richard Donner Cut

link.synopsis: Pro-basketball superstar Michael Jordan slams, Bugs Bunny jams and other Looney Tunes stars hoop it up in this rim-rattlin' roundball romp that's an inspired blend of live-action comedy and cutting-edge animation. The Tune Squad takes on a team of aliens to decide whether the Tunes will stay on Earth or become attractions at an intergalactic theme park. Meanwhile, the aliens have stolen the skills of NBA athletes and become the Monstars.
link.title: synopsis
Buzz Lightyear of Star Command: The Adventure Begins
Mighty Morphin Power Rangers: The Movie
The Bugs Bunny Road Runner Movie
Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles II: The Secret of the Ooze
The Secret of NIMH 2: Timmy to the Rescue
Scooby-Doo and the Legend of the Vampire
The Adventures of the American Rabbit

link.synopsis: Fans of the HBO comedy series "Da Ali G Show" will be delighted to join one of their favorite characters -- the Kazakhstani reporter Borat (Sacha Baron Cohen, in a Golden Globe-winning role) -- as he travels to America to report on the "greatest country in the world." The boorish journalist sets off on his cross-country road trip, but his original purpose is soon subsumed by a much greater quest -- finding and marrying actress Pamela Anderson.
link.title: synopsis
Anchorman: The Legend of Ron Burgundy
Harold & Kumar Escape from Guantanamo Bay
Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back
Talladega Nights: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby
Harold and Kumar Go to White Castle
South Park: Bigger, Longer and Uncut
Monty Python and the Holy Grail
I Love You, Alice B. Toklas!
National Lampoon Presents: Electric Apricot: Quest for Festeroo

link.synopsis: After their production of "Princess Ida" tanks, Arthur Gilbert (Allan Corduner) and William Sullivan (Jim Broadbent) start a cold war that threatens to end their long-lasting partnership -- but  friends and associates work overtime to bring them back together. The result is their classic play "The Mikado." Mike Leigh's thoughtful musical comedy-drama garnered four Academy Award nominations and won for costume design and makeup.
link.title: synopsis
How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying
There's No Business Like Show Business
Genius Within: The Inner Life of Glenn Gould

link.synopsis: When teen geeks Gary (Anthony Michael Hall) and Wyatt (Ilan Mitchell-Smith) use a computer to create Lisa (Kelly LeBrock), a gorgeous woman with a genius IQ, they enlist her help to boost their seemingly pathetic social status. But she thinks the boys just need a lesson in courage. John Hughes writes and directs this classic 1980s teen comedy that co-stars Bill Paxton, Robert Rusler and Robert Downey Jr.
link.title: synopsis
Buffy the Vampire Slayer: The Movie
Girls Just Want to Have Fun

link.synopsis: When four siblings gather to celebrate their father's 70th birthday, the proverbial you-know-what hits the fan because one of them has penned a novel populated by characters who strongly resemble his nearest and dearest. How will this dysfunctional family keep it together after everyone has seemingly been hung out to dry? Barry W. Blaustein's ensemble-cast comedy stars Rainn Wilson, Ron Rifkin, Michael C. Hall and Sarah Silverman.
link.title: synopsis
Before the Devil Knows You're Dead

link.synopsis: Granny's got a little more fight left in her, and to prove it, she sets out to win back her temple -- something Miyoko (aka "Shaolin Grandma") lost a long time ago when she was defeated by martial artist Ippon-ashi. Forced to earn a living as a street performer, Miyoko is now hell-bent on returning to her former mountain home in this kung fu comedy that spoofs director Stephen Chow's Shaolin Soccer.
link.title: synopsis
Shaolin vs. Evil Dead: Ultimate Power
Dr. Wai in the Scripture with No Words
Shaolin Ulysses: Kung Fu Monks in America

link.synopsis: This beautifully shot film combines comedy and tragedy in the tale of a workaholic human resources manager (Mark Ivanir) who neglects his family to further his career. But when an employee at his bakery is killed, he begins an odd journey toward self-realization. Offering to escort the woman's body from Israel back to her Eastern European homeland, the manager is puzzled by eccentric characters along the way but begins to understand the importance of family.
link.title: synopsis
I Do: How to Get Married and Stay Single

link.synopsis: Real-life siblings David and Peter Paul play two brawny twins, one a burglar and one a cop, who form an unlikely alliance to track down the killer of the cop brother's partner and also expose the leader of a diamond smuggling organization. But will the constantly quibbling brothers kill each other before they accomplish their task? John Paragon directs this broad comedy also featuring Roddy McDowall and David Carradine.
link.title: synopsis
Best of the Best 4: Without Warning

link.synopsis: This zany comedy in Meet the Parents fashion is a cautionary tale of bringing home that special someone. Leni's family is a handful: there's her blind grandfather, the belly dancer sister with a 5-year-old daughter, the brother with a newfound relationship with religion, the pre-menopausal mother and the estranged father. Leni brings her fiancé, Rafi, to meet the family, but all chaos ensues when the Jewish clan discovers he's Palestinian.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: This multicultural comedy-drama set in Los Angeles's middle-class environs paints an intriguing portrait of family tensions as four ethnic clans -- Latino, black, Jewish and Asian -- get ready for Thanksgiving dinner. The intertwining tales follow the families as minor frustrations escalate into heated battles and skeletons come out of the closet. Mercedes Ruehl, Kyra Sedgwick, Alfre Woodard, Dennis Haysbert and Joan Chen lead the superb cast.
link.title: synopsis
Marilyn Hotchkiss Ballroom Dancing and Charm School
Daddy's Dyin' ... Who's Got the Will?
A Thousand Years of Good Prayers

link.synopsis: Writer-director Neil LaBute's misanthropic black comedy stars Amy Brenneman, Aaron Eckhart, Catherine Keener, Jason Patric, Ben Stiller and Nastassja Kinski as a web of friends, acquaintances and lovers intertwined in complex, shifting relationships. A theater instructor's lack of prowess frustrates his wife, who in turn has an affair with a lesbian art gallery worker. Meanwhile, a sadistic doctor tries to persuade his married friend to ditch monogamy.
link.title: synopsis
The Ballad of Jack and Rose
Me and You and Everyone We Know

link.synopsis: In Disney's animated follow-up to the 1981 classic, Tod the fox and Copper the hound are up to their usual shenanigans when a trip to the county fair finds Copper joining a howling country-and-western dog band -- and their friendship put to the test. Original music by Trisha Yearwood and other country stars adds to the fun in this family-themed comedy with an all-star voice cast that includes Reba McEntire, Patrick Swayze and Jeff Foxworthy.
link.title: synopsis
Lady and the Tramp II: Scamp's Adventure
The Land Before Time: Through the Eyes of a Spiketail
Cinderella III: A Twist in Time
The Little Mermaid II: Return to the Sea
The Hunchback of Notre Dame II
The Land Before Time VII: Stone of Cold Fire
Stuart Little 3: Call of the Wild
The Land Before Time IX: Journey to Big Water
The Care Bears Movie II: A New Generation
The Land Before Time X: The Great Longneck Migration
Clifford's Puppy Days: Practice Makes Perfect

link.synopsis: In this over-the-top sports comedy set in 1976, funnyman Will Ferrell stars as Jackie Moon, owner and coach of the Flint Michigan Tropics -- the team with the worst record in the renegade American Basketball Association. With the franchise on the brink of collapse, can Jackie's squad rebound to salvation in the National Basketball Association? Woody Harrelson, Maura Tierney, André Benjamin and Andy Richter co-star.
link.title: synopsis
Talladega Nights: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby
Balls Out: Gary the Tennis Coach
Anchorman: The Legend of Ron Burgundy
Walk Hard: The Dewey Cox Story
Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back
South Park: Bigger, Longer and Uncut
You Don't Mess with the Zohan
Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me

link.synopsis: When a terrorist abducts a young princess, Jacques Gambrelli -- the illegitimate son of the bumbling Inspector Clouseau -- takes on the case in the final entry of Blake Edwards's classic comedy series.
link.title: synopsis
The Return of the Pink Panther
I Do: How to Get Married and Stay Single

link.synopsis: In Hitchhike to Hell, innocent-looking deliveryman Howard (Robert Gribbin) kindly offers rides to pretty young girls he plans on brutally murdering, while in Kidnapped Coed, spoiled Sandra (Leslie Rivers) finds herself held hostage by big-time mama's boy Eddie (Jack Canon). In a surprising twist, when Eddie and his frightened victim are unexpectedly attacked by dangerous scumbags, the two escape and go on the run together.
link.title: synopsis
Hooked! / The Flaming Teenage: Double Feature
Evil Come Evil Go / Terror at Orgy Castle / The Hand of Pleasure: Triple Feature
Kiss Me Quick / House on Bare Mountain
Angels / Getting into Heaven: Double Feature
Emanuelle and the White Slave Trade
Hell Hole / Jungle Virgin Force / Ghost Ninja / Primitives
Outskirts / The Girl with the Hatbox
Murder a La Mod / The Moving Finger
The Psycho Lover / Heat of Madness: Double Feature
Sin Syndicate / Sin Magazine / She Came on the Bus: Triple Feature

title.regular: Hitch Hike to Hell / Kidnapped Coed: Double Feature
title.short: Hitch Hike to Hell / Kidnapped Coed

link.synopsis: Love runs wild for a hapless scientist and an unstoppable heiress in Howard Hawks's classic screwball comedy that ranks high on the American Film Institute's list of the funniest Hollywood films ever made. With her eye on paleontologist David (Cary Grant), heiress Susan (Katharine Hepburn) lures him to her home. But the hilarity begins when Susan's dog steals David's prize dinosaur bone and her pet leopard, Baby, is mistaken for a zoo escapee.
link.title: synopsis
I Was a Male War Bride
You Can't Take It with You
I Met Him in Paris / Bluebeard's Eighth Wife

link.synopsis: Gerard Depardieu and Pierre Richard team up in this comedy (later remade in America as Pure Luck) as incompetent cops Campana and Francois, who are searching for the accident-prone daughter of a filthy-rich business titan. Their investigation takes them from the boardrooms of a huge multinational conglomerate all the way to the tropics of Mexico.
link.title: synopsis
I Do: How to Get Married and Stay Single
How Much Do You Love Me?

link.synopsis: Larry (Ted Danson) and Maria (Isabella Rossellini) are "kissing cousins" -- part of an extended Polish-French family related by marriage. But when their respective spouses start sleeping together, Larry and Maria strike back by having an affair of their own. Based on the French film Cousin Cousine, this romantic comedy about complicated family ties also stars Sean Young, William Petersen and Lloyd Bridges. Joel Schumacher directs.
link.title: synopsis
Marilyn Hotchkiss Ballroom Dancing and Charm School

link.synopsis: After losing his job, Craig (Ice Cube) chills with his pothead friend Smokey (Chris Tucker) in their South Central L.A. neighborhood. Over the course of a Friday afternoon, the two get into some crazy trouble checking out hot women, offending dangerous thugs and getting high. Rapper turned actor Ice Cube co-wrote this urban comedy, which features classic hip-hop tracks from the likes of Dr. Dre, Cypress Hill, Mack 10 and more.
link.title: synopsis
Don't Be a Menace to South Central While Drinking Your Juice in the Hood
House Party 4: Down to the Last Minute
Mike Epps: Under Rated & Never Faded

link.synopsis: Radha Mitchell plays two versions of Melinda, a woman who two writers imagine comes undone at a dinner party in different ways -- one as a comedy, the other as a tragedy -- in this Woody Allen concoction. In one plot, Melinda's problems hasten the breakup of her friends' (Chloe Sevigny and Jonny Lee Miller) marriage, while in the other, she throws another couple, Susan and Hobie (Amanda Peet and Will Ferrell), into a hilarious tizzy.
link.title: synopsis
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger

link.synopsis: All-too-aware that they'll be turning 35 soon, four friends struggle to reconcile reality with the hopes and dreams they have about starting families and finding happiness with someone they really love in this comedy directed by radio DJ Russ Parr.
link.title: synopsis
Tyler Perry's Laugh to Keep from Crying
Taken from Me: The Tiffany Rubin Story
Sex and the City: The Movie

link.synopsis: Awakening from a long winter nap to find a subdivision in their backyard, a colony of critters, led by a gun-shy tortoise (Garry Shandling), is forced to face its worst fear -- humans -- with help from an opportunistic raccoon (Bruce Willis). This animated comedy's star-studded voice cast includes Thomas Haden Church, Nick Nolte, Eugene Levy, Catherine O'Hara, Avril Lavigne, William Shatner and Wanda Sykes.
link.title: synopsis
Over the Hedge: Wacky Moments in Human History
The True Story of Puss 'n Boots
The Jungle Book: Rikki-Tikki-Tavi to the Rescue
The Prince and the Pauper: Double Trouble
Globehunters: An Around the World in 80 Days Adventure
An American Tail: Fievel Goes West
Stuart Little 3: Call of the Wild
Little Polar Bear: The Dream of Flying
Romeo & Juliet: Sealed with a Kiss
Little Polar Bear: Lars and the Little Tiger

link.synopsis: Ella of Frell (Anne Hathaway) is given the "gift of obedience" by a fairy, only to realize that it's more of a curse because it could separate her from her true love, Prince Charmont (Hugh Dancy). Will Ella manage to conjure a "cure" that enables her to live happily ever after? Cary Elwes and Minnie Driver co-star in this fantastical comedy based on the Newberry Award-winning children's book by Gail Carson Levine.
link.title: synopsis
R.L. Stine's The Haunting Hour: Don't Think About It
The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch & the Wardrobe
The Chronicles of Narnia: Prince Caspian

link.synopsis: Work problems are piling up for financial exec Evan (Eddie Murphy), and his ruthless rival (Thomas Haden Church), greedy boss (Ronny Cox) and touchy-feely best (DeRay Davis) friend aren't helping matters. But when Evan discovers a pathway to his daughter's imaginary world, he starts finding some solutions. Nicole Ari Parker co-stars as Evan's estranged wife in this inventive family comedy from Over the Hedge director Karey Kirkpatrick.
link.title: synopsis
Hannah Montana: Livin' the Rock Star Life
Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs
Spy Kids: All the Time in the World
Dragons: Gift of the Night Fury / Book of Dragons

link.synopsis: This campy comedy features zombies, vampires, a dancing mummy and the most rockin' haunted house ever. Two bumbling cops, Buford (Sherman Hemsley) and Benny (Luis Avalos), are sent to investigate the home and evict the inhabitants -- who turn out to be ghosts intent on staying put. As Buford and Benny blunder through the crumbling antebellum mansion, they have close encounters with two sexy specters and the unhappy spirit of a former slave owner.
link.title: synopsis
The Zany Adventures of Robin Hood

link.synopsis: Classic stand-up comedians such as Sarah Silverman, Tom Green, Carrot Top, Paul Rodriguez and others pontificate on what it's like trying to make an audience crack up. The camera then shifts to the general public, who are approached on the street and asked to explain how they make people laugh. A must-see for comedy fans who really want to gain an insight into that elusive alchemy that makes a joke funny, or not!
link.title: synopsis
The Killing of a Chinese Cookie
Young & Handsome: An Evening with Jeff Garlin
Dana Gould: Let Me Put My Thoughts In You
Bob & Tom: Comedy All Stars Tour
A Lawyer Walks into a Bar...
The Amazing Johnathan: Wrong on Every Level
Janeane Garofalo: If You Will: Live in Seattle
The Comedians of Comedy: Live at the El Rey
Bob & Tom Radio: The Comedy Tour
The Comedians of Comedy: The Movie
Penn & Teller's Magic and Mystery Tour
Basic Black: The Lewis Black Story
John Oliver's New York Stand-Up Show
Mr. Warmth: The Don Rickles Project
Andrew Dice Clay: One Night with Dice
Sam Kinison: Why Did We Laugh?
Jamie Kennedy: Unwashed: The Stand-Up Special
The Second City: The First Family of Comedy
Comedy Express: B.T.: I'm Not Black Enough
The Axis of Evil Comedy Tour
Kevin Nealon: Now Hear Me Out!

link.synopsis: Outrageous prankster Yehuda Barkan returns to the streets of Israel for his second "Candid Camera"-style film that has him pulling practical jokes on average citizens, such as when he convinces people that an alien spaceship has landed in Tel Aviv. Other gags include an ATM that speaks English to bewildered patrons, a family aghast to find their Mohel wielding a butcher knife and a buxom pedestrian convinced to audition for a topless commercial.
link.title: synopsis
How Tasty Was My Little Frenchman
How Much Do You Love Me?
Don't Let Me Die on a Sunday
Bob & Tom: Comedy All Stars Tour

link.synopsis: Hiring a nanny sounds like the perfect fix for Marsha (Cynthia Preston) and David McMillan (Larry Dorf), who are already saddled with stress and now have a brand-new baby on the way. But when their hired help (Alla Korot) arrives from the Ukraine, she imports a whole new set of problems. Howard Hesseman and Mindy Sterling co-star in this independent comedy based on screenwriter Andrea Malamut's own experiences as a first-time mother.
link.title: synopsis
The Brady Bunch in the White House
Daddy's Dyin' ... Who's Got the Will?

link.synopsis: After having a passionate one-night stand, Jonathan (Christopher Colquhoun) discovers that his new client at work is none other than his new lover, David (Stephen Billington). They call it quits personally in order to work together professionally, but the fires of love continue to burn brightly, and both decide to do some crazy things to make it work. Ian Poitier directs this romantic comedy also featuring Jocelyn Osorio.
link.title: synopsis
The Best of Boys in Love

link.synopsis: When a mystery needs to be solved, and it's not a whodunit but rather a maze involving complex emotions, it requires the expertise of intellectual -- and perhaps slightly kooky -- detectives Vivian (Lily Tomlin) and Bernard (Dustin Hoffman). Jude Law and Naomi Watts co-star in David O. Russell's quirky comedy that finds the existential husband-and-wife team helping a do-gooding client (Jason Schwartzman) who's plagued by twists of fate.
link.title: synopsis
The Life Aquatic with Steve Zissou
Me and You and Everyone We Know
Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind

link.synopsis: Combining wicked satire with an engrossing mystery, this black comedy follows charismatic pastor Dan Day, whose megachurch is endangered when he becomes entangled in an unsavory incident being investigated by a hapless parishioner.
link.title: synopsis
I Don't Know How She Does It
The Man in the White Suit

link.synopsis: When Roy Fleming's (Don Knotts) number gets called to become a NASA astronaut, the vertigo-suffering, lovable loser is suddenly the apple of his controlling dad's (Arthur O'Connell) eye and the town hero. But it's not what it seems. See, Roy is a custodial trainee, so he won't become a &NFi;real&NFi_; space explorer. But what will happen if he reveals the truth? Leslie Nielsen, Frank McGrath and Jesse White co-star in this Edward Montagne-directed comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Shakiest Gun in the West
Journey to the Center of the Earth
Buzz Lightyear of Star Command: The Adventure Begins
A Kid in King Arthur's Court

link.synopsis: Casey Siemaszko, Anne Ryan, Jeffrey Tambor and Richard Tyson star in this charming comedy about a kid named Jerry, who has just seven hours to polish up his fighting skills so he can survive a face-off at the end of the day with the school's meanest bully, Buddy. With the help of his sister, his friends and a heaping dose of good humor, Jerry hopes he'll end up on top. But there's no telling what'll happen at 3 o'clock ...
link.title: synopsis
See No Evil, Hear No Evil
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Chris Farley

link.synopsis: In this dark comedy, opportunistic Sunny Cannald (Teri Garr) is fed up with being married to bombastic butcher Ernie (Bruce McGill). So, when he ends up accidentally freezing to death in his shop's cold room following a fight with his business partner, Dave (John Lithgow), Sunny smells a way out. After Dave discovers the body, he's convinced that he's to blame and turns to Sunny for help -- but it'll be a frosty day in hell before that happens.
link.title: synopsis
Daddy's Dyin' ... Who's Got the Will?

link.synopsis: In this lively comedy from DreamWorks Animation and Aardman Features (Wallace & Gromit), London high-society mouse Roddy (voiced by Hugh Jackman) is flushed down the toilet by Syd, a common sewer rat. Hang on for a madcap adventure deep in the bowels of Ratropolis, where Roddy meets the resourceful Rita (Kate Winslet), the rodent-hating Toad (Ian McKellen) and his faithful thugs Spike and Whitey (Andy Serkis and Bill Nighy).
link.title: synopsis
Wallace & Gromit: The Curse of the Were-Rabbit
Wallace & Gromit in Three Amazing Adventures
Penguins of Madagascar: New to the  Zoo
The Secret of NIMH 2: Timmy to the Rescue

link.synopsis: Adam Sandler stars as the titular Zohan, an Israeli counterterrorism soldier with a secretly fabulous ambition to become a Manhattan hairstylist, in this comedy he also co-wrote with Judd Apatow and Robert Smigel. Zohan's desire runs so deep that he'll do anything -- including faking his own death and going head-to-head with an Arab cab driver (Rob Schneider) -- to make his dreams come true. John Turturro and Emmanuelle Chriqui also star.
link.title: synopsis
I Now Pronounce You Chuck and Larry
Austin Powers: International Man of Mystery
Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me
Big Mommas: Like Father, Like Son
Trailer Park Boys: Countdown to Liquor Day

title.regular: You Don't Mess with the Zohan
title.short: You Don't Mess with the Zohan

link.synopsis: Based on the best-selling book by Tucker Max, this comedy follows the gleefully boozy antics of the author -- played by Matt Czuchry -- whose outrageous behavior at a friend's bachelor party jeopardizes the impending nuptials.
link.title: synopsis
The 41-Year-Old Virgin Who Knocked Up Sarah Marshall and Felt Superbad About It
The Drawn Together Movie: The Movie!
American Pie Presents: The Book of Love
Revenge of the Nerds IV: Nerds in Love

title.regular: I Hope They Serve Beer in Hell
title.short: I Hope They Serve Beer in Hell

link.synopsis: Unfortunately for the guys on Sweden's only all-male synchronized swim team, a passion for their sport does not necessarily equal a proficiency in it. But that's not going to stop them in their quest for gold in this comedy from Mans Herngren. Determined to prove naysayers wrong, the middle-aged mermen work first to improve their swimming and then synchronize it as they fervently pursue their ultimate goal -- the world championship.
link.title: synopsis
Straight Men and the Men Who Love Them 2

link.synopsis: In this bloody shocker inspired by a true story, Nobuyuki Syamoto -- the downtrodden proprietor of a tropical fish business -- finds himself drawn into the world of a twisted serial killer and his equally psychotic young wife.
link.title: synopsis
The Last Days of the World
Muoi: the Legend of the Portrait

link.synopsis: In this classic screwball comedy, Bob Hope stars as hapless life insurance salesman Milford Farnsworth, a man who unwittingly sells a policy to the notorious Wild West outlaw Jesse James (Wendell Corey). Of course, when Farnsworth tries to cancel the policy, James has more than a few tricks up his sleeve. Directed by Norman Z. McLeod, this film also features cameos by legendary Western stars Gary Cooper, Roy Rogers, Gene Autry and James Garner.
link.title: synopsis
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!
Who's Been Sleeping in My Bed?
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend
The Last Time I Saw Archie

link.synopsis: Imperial guard Ah Ching (Yuen Biao) vows to avenge a princess after sadistic soldier Fung San (Yuen Wah) rapes and murders her. A swordfight sends the adversaries over a cliff and into a glacier, where they're frozen in conflict for 300 years. But when the ice melts, the warriors remain at odds in modern-day Hong Kong. Now, Ah Ching must save a street-savvy hooker (Maggie Cheung) before Fung San resumes his old ways.
link.title: synopsis
Once Upon a Time in China
Zu: Warriors From The Magic Mountain
Once Upon a Time in China: The Next Chapters

link.synopsis: After decades of world war and a plague that wiped out much of the population, mankind struggles to rebuild its once-great civilization. Progress is at last being made ... until the eve of a new manned space flight. Now, fear of another technological era threatens to tear apart the new society. Raymond Massey, Cedric Hardwicke and Ralph Richardson star in a story by H.G. Wells, adapted by the author himself.
link.title: synopsis
The Shape of Things to Come
The Man Who Could Work Miracles
I Married a Monster from Outer Space
Rocky Jones, Space Ranger: Beyond the Moon
Never Take Candy from a Stranger / These Are the Damned
Drive-in Double Feature: Creation of the Humanoids / War Between the Planets
The End of August at the Hotel Ozone

link.synopsis: The two Coreys are back! In this follow-up to the 1989 romantic comedy hit, Haim and Feldman reprise their roles as Dinger and Bobby, bored roommates whose lives turn upside down when they receive two pairs of magical sunglasses. At first, the supernatural shades give the pals plenty of fun. That is, until the evil genius behind the strange inventions comes looking for his prized creations. A trippy chase through Los Angeles ensues.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: This award-winning film centers on the lives of the inhabitants of the Five Corners section of the Bronx in 1964. Jodie Foster stars as Linda, a young woman who turns to her ex-boyfriend Harry (Tim Robbins) to protect her from an unhinged admirer (John Turturro), only to be stymied by formerly tough Harry's new belief in pacifism. Tony Bill directed this winning mix of offbeat comedy and suspense.
link.title: synopsis
Some Folks Call It a Sling Blade

link.synopsis: Serial bank robbers, sometime lovers and folkloric heroes Bonnie Parker (Faye Dunaway) and Clyde Barrow (Warren Beatty) barrel across Depression-ravaged America on a shooting spree that ends in a deadly rain of bullets and tragedy. Directed by Arthur Penn, this stylish and sexy film shattered the mold when it came to crime pictures, layering comedy onto mayhem and youthful criminality. Gene Wilder makes his big-screen debut.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Supporting Actor in a Motion Picture nominee
category.term: Best Supporting Actor in a Motion Picture nominee

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Drama) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Drama) nominee

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Drama) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Drama) nominee

link.title: The Trial of Lee Harvey Oswald / The Other Side of Bonnie and Clyde: Double Feature
Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid
One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest
The Good, the Bad and the Ugly

link.synopsis: Golden Globe-nominated as Best Foreign Language Film, this uplifting comedy follows fallen Russian maestro Andrey Filipov (Aleksey Guskov), who seizes a chance to reunite his orchestra and reclaim his life 30 years after politics cut short his music career. After intercepting an invitation sent to the Bolshoi to perform at a Paris theater, Filipov gathers a ragtag band of ex-colleagues and a French violinist (Mélanie Laurent) to realize his dream.
link.title: synopsis
No One Knows About Persian Cats

link.synopsis: Sgt. Ali McCormick leads her Vancouver PD Homicide Division in cracking sometimes decades-old cold cases, including a hooker who burned to death, a debutante's disappearance, the decapitation of two nurses and more.
link.title: synopsis
Wire in the Blood: Prayer of the Bone
P.D. James: Death of an Expert Witness
P.D. James: A Taste for Death
P.D. James: Shroud for a Nightingale
Masterpiece Mystery!: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries: Missing Joseph
Masterpiece Mystery!: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries: For the Sake of Elena
Cold Case Files: The Most Infamous Cases
Masterpiece Mystery!: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries: Well-Schooled in Murder
Masterpiece Mystery!: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries: Payment in Blood

link.synopsis: Widowed U.S. president Andrew Shepherd (Michael Douglas), one of the world's most powerful men, can have anything he wants -- and what he covets most is Sydney Ellen Wade (Annette Bening), a Washington lobbyist. But Shepherd's attempts at courting her spark wild rumors and decimate his approval ratings in this romantic comedy. Rob Reiner directs, and Michael J. Fox and Martin Sheen co-star. The film was nominated for a Best Score Oscar.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: President Barack Obama: The Man and His Journey

link.synopsis: Engaged to wealthy Julia Seton (Doris Nolan), freethinker Johnny Case (Cary Grant) discovers that her family wants to remake him into their idea of the perfect son-in-law -- and he's beginning to consider compromising his values. But as he gets to know Julia's headstrong sister (Katharine Hepburn), he realizes he has more in common with her. Directed by George Cukor, this witty romantic comedy earned an Oscar nomination for Best Art Direction.
link.title: synopsis
I Was a Male War Bride
You Can't Take It with You
Deanna Durbin: Three Smart Girls / Something in the Wind

link.synopsis: The famed New York nightspot is the setting for this brassy musical comedy starring Betty Hutton as Judy Peabody, a coat check girl at the club who saves the life of J.B. Bates (Barry Fitzgerald), a drowning bum who turns out to be a millionaire. He's so grateful that he sets Judy up for life, but all this attention leads her boyfriend, Danny (Don DeFore), to think J.B.'s got ulterior motives. Andy Russell and Bill Goodwin co-star.
link.title: synopsis
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!
There's No Business Like Show Business
I Was a Male War Bride

link.synopsis: Edgy comedy maverick Richard Pryor finds his gooey center in this sweet-natured, 1981 road trip. Pryor, who cowrote the script, plays Joe Braxton, an ex-con hired to drive a busload of ornery, emotionally disturbed children from Philadelphia to Washington state. Along the way, he teaches the kids invaluable life lessons such as fishing and strip poker. Cicely Tyson plays the straight-laced educator who falls for Pryor's goofy charms.
link.title: synopsis
See No Evil, Hear No Evil
Five on the Black Hand Side
Richard Pryor: Live on the Sunset Strip
The Autobiography of Miss Jane Pittman
R. Kelly Live! The Light It Up Tour
Donnell Rawlings: From Ashy to Classy

link.synopsis: In the summer of 1994, with Major League Baseball ix-nayed by a strike, America's other pastime captures the nation's attention when hunky hidden talent Ted Whitfield (Ross Patterson) turns from sandlot oddity to bona-fide Wiffle ball phenom. In this shaggy-dog comedy, &NFi;The Van Nuys Times&NFi_; tracks the hitting star's every bat-bending tantrum as he guns for the home run record and copes with the intoxicating effects of overwhelming success.
link.title: synopsis
4192: The Crowning of the Hit King

link.synopsis: Bette Davis handles the title role in this highly offbeat crime comedy about two aging hippies who elect to rob a bank to restore Bunny O'Hare's financial affairs after she's been unjustly evicted and rendered homeless. When that heist ends up paying off, rather than take off for the border, Bunny opts for a life of crime with her new partner, Bill Green, played by fellow Oscar-winner Ernest Borgnine.
link.title: synopsis
How to Beat the High Cost of Living
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend
Don't Worry, We'll Think of a Title

link.synopsis: Grace (Jackie "Moms" Mabley) is a tough, God-fearing, no-nonsense granny from the 'hood who learns that her neighbor, mayoral candidate Welton (Moses Gunn), is nothing but a pawn for the white political establishment. Now she's on a mission to make it right, and Baltimore politics will never be the same after this sassy senior citizen gets through with it. This riotous comedy co-stars Stepin Fetchit, Slappy White and Butterfly McQueen.
link.title: synopsis
Five on the Black Hand Side
Keepin' the Faith: Momma's Got a Boyfriend
The Autobiography of Miss Jane Pittman
Don't Touch If You Ain't Prayed 2
The Gospel Comedy All-Stars 3:  Don't Judge Me!

link.synopsis: This dizzying blend of action, adventure, comedy and romance stars international martial arts sensation Chow Yun-Fat as a CIA agent assigned to steal a Chinese national treasure. Awaiting further instruction about his mission, the operative settles in at a Shaolin temple, where he tangles with the resident monks and forms a liaison with a beautiful captive (Jacqueline Wu Chien-Lien) who possesses startling psychic abilities.
link.title: synopsis
Shaolin vs. Evil Dead: Ultimate Power

link.synopsis: Adulterer Nick (James Gandolfini) must face the bleak fallout of his exposed affair with foul-mouthed Tula (Kate Winslet) after his stolid wife (Susan Sarandon) and daughters Constance (Mary-Louise Parker), Baby (Aida Turturro) and Rosebud (Mandy Moore) wise up. When they can't find the right words to express their anger, everyone breaks out into song in writer-director John Turturro's dark comedy. Steve Buscemi and Christopher Walken co-star.
link.title: synopsis
A Wink and a Smile: The Art of Burlesque
How Much Do You Love Me?
Marilyn Hotchkiss Ballroom Dancing and Charm School
Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind

link.synopsis: When the multinational corporation that owns all holidays gives them a pink slip, beer-swilling, cigarette-smoking Easter bunnies Hank (Thomas Michael) and Mike (Paolo Mancini) are forced to brave the cold, harsh world of unemployment. Co-written by Michael and Mancini, this irreverent blue-collar comedy from director Matthiew Klinck also stars Joe Mantegna (TV's" Criminal Minds") and Chris Klein (American Pie).
link.title: synopsis
The Immaculate Conception of Little Dizzle
A Film with Me in It
The Boys and Girls Guide to Getting Down
He Died with a Felafel in His Hand

link.synopsis: Hildy Johnson (Rosalind Russell) is about to get hitched to dull insurance agent Bruce Baldwin (Ralph Bellamy) -- that's if her ex-husband, ruthless newspaper publisher Walter Burns (Cary Grant), doesn't succeed in winning her back in this battle-of-the-sexes screwball comedy. Meanwhile, reporters salivating for the scoop on a local voting conspiracy is just a minor distraction as Burns pulls out all the stops for the woman he loves.
link.title: synopsis
I Was a Male War Bride
My Sister Eileen / She Wouldn't Say Yes

link.synopsis: With four corpses on his hands, New York City gumshoe Mike Reilly (Stephen Dorff) teams with Department of Health worker Terry Huston (Natascha McElhone) to track down a homicidal sadist who telecasts shocking acts of torture on the Internet. But they have their work cut out: It seems the victims' only link is that they all went toes up 48 hours after logging on to a site known as feardot.com. Stephen Rea also stars in this gruesome thriller.
link.title: synopsis
Masters of Horror: Lucky McKee: Sick Girl
Masters of Horror: Dario Argento: Jenifer
I Still Know What You Did Last Summer

link.synopsis: Electric forró band Mastruz Com Leite puts on a dynamic performance in this live concert, inspiring fans with their unique style that blends traditional Brazilian music with contemporary electric instruments to create a new pop sound. Songs include "Do Farro Do Grilo a New York," "Teu Silencio," "Noite Fria," "Anjo de Guarda," "Menino Sem Juizo," "Licao de Vida," "Mil Tentativas," "Na Ponta Do Pe" and more.
link.title: synopsis
Rocio Durcal: Amor Eterno: Los Exitos
Avioes Do Forro: Ja Tomei Porre Por Voce: Vol. 1
Linda Ronstadt: Canciones de Mi Padre
Lo Mejor de la Quebradita en Vivo
Pablo Montero: Entrega Total Los Exitos
Shakira: Live and Off the Record
Frankie Needles: Latinos Stand Up: Vol. 1
Jose Jose: La Historia del Principe
Familia Lima: 10 Anos Ao Vivo Em Gramado
Lo Esencial De: Control / La Onda
Cantando Por Un Sueno: Reyes de la Cancion
Lo Mejor de la Sierra: Super Exitos en DVD
Viento Y Sol: Super Exitos en DVD
Hustle Up DVD Magazine Latino: Primera Edicion
Gipsy Kings: Live at Kenwood House in London
Most Famous Hits: Ricky Martin - Live in Spain
El Poder del Norte: 13 Anos De Exitos En Vivo
Ana Gabriel: En La Plaza de Toros, Mexico

title.regular: Forro Mastruz Com Leite: Mastruz E Mastruz! O Show

link.synopsis: Intent on finding the man of her dreams, a young woman hits the dating scene in this romantic comedy. Katie (Marla Schaffel) endures one bad date after another in her quest to find Mr. Right. She rejects her best friend, Ben (Mitchell Whitfield), when he expresses his interest in her, choosing suave Richard (Michael Harris) instead. Richard seems perfect at first, but Katie learns the hard way that true love was right in front of her all along.
link.title: synopsis

title.regular: I Love You, Don't Touch Me
title.short: I Love You, Don't Touch Me

link.synopsis: This raucous English comedy follows a group of unemployed British steel-mill workers who, broke and bored, devise a fabulous scheme to get off the dole: Become male strippers! Soon they're a sensation with the ladies, who encourage the men to show the "full monty" (strip down to the skin). This quirky 1997 sleeper is full of character and great humor.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: Once Upon a Time in the Midlands
The Englishman Who Went Up a Hill but Came Down a Mountain
Miss Pettigrew Lives for a Day
Tristram Shandy: A Cock and Bull Story

link.synopsis: Think you've had a bad day? At every turn, marketing exec Neal Page's (Steve Martin) plans to get home to his family for Thanksgiving get foiled, and somehow the loudmouthed, idiosyncratic fellow traveler Del Griffith (John Candy) is always right next to him driving him nuts. Will this odd couple make it to Chicago without killing each other? Ben Stein and Edie McClurg also appear in writer-director John Hughes's comedy classic.
link.title: synopsis
City Slickers II: The Legend of Curly's Gold

link.synopsis: The late off-the-wall stand-up comedian Mitch Hedberg had drawn comparisons to deadpan comic Steven Wright at his drollest and had attracted a huge fan base who grooved to his bizarre musings and one-liners. Get hip to Hedberg's timeless observations and stoner demeanor with this sampling of his best on-air performances, featuring unedited footage from a 1999 "Comedy Central Presents" special recorded at The Palace in Hollywood, Calif.
link.title: synopsis
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Over the Edge
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Vol. 2: On the Edge
Patton Oswalt: My Weakness Is Strong
Steven Wright: When the Leaves Blow Away
Patton Oswalt: No Reason to Complain: Uncensored
Aziz Ansari: Intimate Moments for a Sensual Evening
Bill Hicks Live: Satirist, Social Critic, Stand-up Comedian
The Amazing Johnathan: Wrong on Every Level
Joe Rogan: Talking Monkeys in Space
Aisha Tyler Is Lit: Live at the Fillmore
Carlos Mencia: No Strings Attached: Live, Extended and Uncensored
Vince Vaughn's Wild West Comedy Show
Jamie Foxx Presents: America's Funniest Comics: Vol. 3
Charlie Murphy: I Will Not Apologize
Rod Z: I Ain't Lied Yet!
Richard Pryor: Live on the Sunset Strip
Ron White: They Call Me "Tater Salad"
Platinum Comedy Series: The Torry Brothers: A Family Affair
Dave Chappelle: For What It's Worth
The Big Black Comedy Show: Vol. 1
Jeff Foxworthy: You Might Be a Redneck / Check Your Neck
Bill Maher: Victory Begins at Home

link.synopsis: Just as Rosie (Michelle Pfeiffer) strikes up a passionate romance with a handsome younger man (Paul Rudd), her daughter, Izzie (Saoirse Ronan), falls in love for the first time -- and Mother Nature (Tracey Ullman) can't resist the temptation to meddle in their affairs. Writer-director Amy Heckerling delivers a twisted romantic comedy that shows what happens when a mother and daughter come to blows with the forces of nature.
link.title: synopsis
The Private Lives of Pippa Lee

title.regular: I Could Never Be Your Woman
title.short: I Could Never Be Your Woman

link.synopsis: With his trusty steed, Cactus, and his silly sidekick, Frog (played by Western comedy star Smiley Burnette, who actually gets top billing here), cowboy Sunset Carson takes on an outlaw gang to keep the town from falling under the baddies' control. The boys have their hands full, however, with the gang ringleader acting as the town barber while working behind the scenes to install his buddy as sheriff and his gang as deputies.
link.title: synopsis
Gene Autry Collection: Stardust on the Sage
Gene Autry Collection: Call of the Canyon

link.synopsis: Daring animal activists arrive with surveillance equipment at a scenic cove in Taijii, Japan, to capture footage of a secretive and heavily guarded operation run by the world's largest supplier of dolphins. As the group sets out to expose the horrifying truths behind the capture of dolphins for the lucrative tourist industry, they also uncover an environmental catastrophe. Louie Psihoyos directs this riveting, Oscar-winning documentary.
link.title: synopsis
The Most Dangerous Man in America: Daniel Ellsberg and the Pentagon Papers
A Crude Awakening: The Oil Crash
American Experience: Into the Deep: America, Whaling & the World

link.synopsis: When uptight Yale law student Sherman (Michael Shulman) gets dumped by his girlfriend (Lacey Chabert) and cut off from the family fortune in one fell swoop, he hitches a ride to Los Angeles with former Olympic ski champion Palmer (James LeGros) in this captivating indie comedy. A series of unexpected adventures with the eccentric slacker begins to open Sherman's eyes to some new realities. Enrico Colantoni and Donna Murphy co-star.
link.title: synopsis
He Died with a Felafel in His Hand
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog

link.synopsis: George Clooney, Mark Wahlberg and Ice Cube star in this satirical dark comedy from writer-director David O. Russell (Flirting with Disaster) as a group of American soldiers stationed in Iraq at the end of the Gulf War. When the three arguably wise men find a map they believe will take them to a huge cache of stolen Kuwaiti gold hidden near their base, they embark on a secret mission that's destined to change everything.
link.title: synopsis
The Men Who Stare at Goats

link.synopsis: Drunken tomfoolery, the beautiful invention of the bidet, and a novel approach to funding the Iraq War are just a few of the many comedy morsels served up by funnyman Ron White in this hilarious stand-up set. White, whose star rose as a member of the Blue Collar Comedy Tour, also scored successes with his popular Comedy Central special You Can't Fix Stupid and his runaway hit They Call Me Tater Salad.
link.title: synopsis
Ron White: You Can't Fix Stupid
Ron White: They Call Me "Tater Salad"
Blue Collar Comedy Tour Rides Again
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Working Class Comics
Larry the Cable Guy: Tailgate Party
Blue Collar Comedy Tour: One for the Road
Lewis Black: Red, White and Screwed
Larry the Cable Guy: Morning Constitutions
Jeff Foxworthy: You Might Be a Redneck / Check Your Neck
Blue Collar Comedy Tour: The Next Generation
Bill Engvall: A Decade of Laughs
Blue Collar Comedy Tour: The Movie
Roast of Bob Saget: Uncensored Extended
South Park: Bigger, Longer and Uncut
George Carlin: You are All Diseased
Bill Maher: Victory Begins at Home

link.synopsis: This black comedy finds bookie Cosmo Reif "promoted" to hit man, a dubious position for which veteran killer Steve trains him. But when the reluctant Cosmo questions his new calling, he discovers that it's not so easy to change a mob boss's mind.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: This irreverent comedy follows the students of No Use High School, where flaunting sexuality is the norm. But teenage angst still reigns supreme among the school's outcasts, including the only virgin, a prostitute and a conflicted visitor.
link.title: synopsis
Woman Is the Future of Man
The Virgin Stripped Bare by Her Bachelors
The Last Days of the World
Once Upon a Time in Seoul
I'm a Cyborg, but That's Ok

link.synopsis: When four high school buddies hit the beach for a last summertime fling before they go their separate ways, bogus guidance from a booze-buying pal and their own half-baked schemes put the brakes on their dreams of unlimited beer and uncensored babes. But as their hormone-driven plans unravel, they discover what it means to have true friends. Ryan Gielen directs this comedy that stars Rob Bradford, Blake Merriman, Nick Vergara and Mike Pennacchio.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Struggling to find success in New York City, Adam (Joshua Leonard) and Chloe (Molly Ringwald) are a waiter and waitress  in a swanky restaurant, surrounded by eccentric co-workers who hash out their personal lives while trying to make ends meet. Director Michael Rauch's refreshingly irreverent romantic comedy is dedicated to the single life, complete with thrills, heartache and everything in between.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: A pampered African prince (Eddie Murphy) wants more out of life than the beautiful woman to whom he's engaged. So, he heads to America to find a mate who will fall for him, not his riches, in this comedy from John Landis. Joined by his trusty sidekick (Arsenio Hall), the prince plunges into a job at a fast-food chain -- and romance with the boss's daughter. Murphy and Hall play a range of colorful characters, thanks to Oscar-nominated makeup wizardry.
link.title: synopsis
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Eddie Murphy
The Nutty Professor II: The Klumps

link.synopsis: What begins as an uproarious comedy evolves into a provocative, disquieting drama as director Spike Lee chronicles trivial events that bring festering racial tensions to the surface on a sweltering day in a largely black Brooklyn neighborhood. After a number of minor misunderstandings -- and an effort to boycott the local pizza parlor -- a young man (Bill Nunn) lies dead, the pizzeria lies in ashes, and the racial schism is wider than ever.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Supporting Actor in a Motion Picture nominee
category.term: Best Supporting Actor in a Motion Picture nominee

link.title: The Cook, The Thief, His Wife, and Her Lover

link.synopsis: Getting a hold of a camera changes everything for young Will (Bill Milner), whose ultrareligious parents forbid him to watch TV or go to the movies, in this nostalgic comedy from the team behind The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy. The film chronicles the unlikely friendship that blossoms between Will and class bully Lee (Will Poulter) when the latter recruits Will to help him make a home movie inspired by Rambo: First Blood.
link.title: synopsis
The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels
It's Kind of a Funny Story
Looking for Comedy in the Muslim World

link.synopsis: When businesses are failing, they call in Don Ready (Jeremy Piven), a fast-talking closer who can sell anything to anybody. Hired to rescue a flagging auto dealership during a Fourth of July sale, Don spends his days on the lot and his nights at local strip clubs. Everything's going swimmingly … until he gets blindsided by love. Ving Rhames and Kathryn Hahn co-star in this comedy from "Chappelle's Show" producer Neal Brennan.
link.title: synopsis

title.regular: The Goods: Live Hard, Sell Hard
title.short: The Goods: Live Hard, Sell Hard

link.synopsis: Tasked with improving the bottom line of a small, old-fashioned moccasin factory, a cutthroat management consultant (Anthony Hopkins) plans to lay off more than half the workers. But as he gets to know the eccentric employees, he begins to have a change of heart. Russell Crowe, Toni Collette and Ben Mendelsohn co-star in this charming comedy set in 1960s Australia.

link.synopsis: In this star-laden slice-of-life comedy set in France, workers ponder a sign reading "Lonely Man" that hangs out the office facing theirs, a mix of visitors traverse the town square and the clerks of a local shop commingle with their patrons.
